description.narrative: Discontinued. Merged with Output 1By 2022, the Ministry of Planning, Development and Reform endorses a comprehensive multi- sectoral CRVS strategy with clear modalities for embedding provincial birth registration data into the national system., which contributes to Access To Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, 65 % of girls and boys under-5 are registered in Pakistan, with universal birth registration achieved and embedded within civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) systems in two provinces, children access appropriate child protection preventive and/or response services, primarily through public case management and referral system in at least two provinces, and communities practice positive behaviours contributing towards a protective environment for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Discontinued. Merged with Output 1By 2022, the Ministry of Planning, Development and Reform endorses a comprehensive multi- sectoral CRVS strategy with clear modalities for embedding provincial birth registration data into the national system.

description.narrative: Under the leadership of the Ministry of Planning, Development and Reform at the national level, with local government and planning and development departments in all four provinces, the CRVS agenda was enhanced, with thematic consultations, in-depth provincial CRVS assessments and a national infrastructure assessment, national policy and legislative mapping in the pipeline to feed into the National CRVS Strategic Framework. A south-south learning exchange to Peru, facilitated by UNICEF, resulted in a diplomatic tie between the countries to further enhance collaboration and cross-learning opportunities on CRVS | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Existence of a national civil registration and vital statistics strategy(ies) which reflects recent international standards and principles for CRVS systems and are in line with the human rights conventions and protocols ratified by the State

actual.value: 2020:The Government has proposed a joint CRVS assessment/feasibility between UNICEF and World Bank. As a result, the target of the completion of this has been extended across the provinces

title.narrative: Number of Civil Registrars or other cadres (i.e. health workers, community leaders, teachers act.) who are legally mandated to notify or register births and who have received trainingon birth notification or registration

baseline.value: Punjab: Health workers /Nikah registrars /Union Council Secretaries trained 2454 Sindh Health workers /Nikah registrars /Union Council Secretaries trained 1730 KP: 0 FATA: 500 local leaders trained

target.value: 2022:Punjab: Health workers /Nikah registrars /Union Council Secretaries trained 7633 Sindh Health workers /Nikah registrars /Union Council Secretaries Trained 3522 KP: 4000 Local Government elected represetntives,500 V/C,N/C secretaries FATA: 3500 Local Leaders, 2000 health education staff trained
